outputs.name: mat
outputs.description:
A standard opaque material that can be assigned to a Honeybee
Opaque construction.

inputs.name: _name_
inputs.description:
Text to set the name for the material and to be incorporated into
a unique material identifier.

inputs.name: _thickness
inputs.description: Number for the thickness of the material layer [m].

inputs.name: _conductivity
inputs.description: Number for the thermal conductivity of the material [W/m-K].

inputs.name: _density
inputs.description: Number for the density of the material [kg/m3].

inputs.name: _spec_heat
inputs.description: Number for the specific heat of the material [J/kg-K].

inputs.name: _roughness_
inputs.description:
Text describing the relative roughness of the material.
Must be one of the following: 'VeryRough', 'Rough', 'MediumRough',
'MediumSmooth', 'Smooth', 'VerySmooth'. (Default: 'MediumRough').

inputs.name: _therm_absp_
inputs.description:
A number between 0 and 1 for the fraction of incident long
wavelength radiation that is absorbed by the material. (Default: 0.9).

inputs.name: _sol_absp_
inputs.description:
A number between 0 and 1 for the fraction of incident solar
radiation absorbed by the material. (Default: 0.7).

inputs.name: _vis_absp_
inputs.description:
A number between 0 and 1 for the fraction of incident
visible wavelength radiation absorbed by the material.
Default value is the same as the _sol_absp_.

try:  # import the core honeybee dependencies
    from honeybee.typing import clean_and_id_ep_string, clean_ep_string
except ImportError as e:
    raise ImportError('\nFailed to import honeybee:\n\t{}'.format(e))

try:  # import the honeybee-energy dependencies
    from honeybee_energy.material.opaque import EnergyMaterial
except ImportError as e:
    raise ImportError('\nFailed to import honeybee_energy:\n\t{}'.format(e))

try:  # import ladybug_{{cad}} dependencies
    from ladybug_{{cad}}.{{plugin}} import all_required_inputs
except ImportError as e:
    raise ImportError('\nFailed to import ladybug_{{cad}}:\n\t{}'.format(e))


if all_required_inputs(ghenv.Component):
    # set the default material properties
    _roughness_ = 'MediumRough' if _roughness_ is None else _roughness_
    _therm_absp_ = 0.9 if _therm_absp_ is None else _therm_absp_
    _sol_absp_ = 0.7 if _sol_absp_ is None else _sol_absp_
    name = clean_and_id_ep_string('OpaqueMaterial') if _name_ is None else \
        clean_ep_string(_name_)

    # create the material
    mat = EnergyMaterial(
        name, _thickness, _conductivity, _density, _spec_heat, _roughness_,
        _therm_absp_, _sol_absp_, _vis_absp_)
    if _name_ is not None:
        mat.display_name = _name_
